item.title: Semantics of u̱t‑Maꞌin noun classes
item.description:
Note: The page numbers in the table of contents in this book are wrong. My chapter is really pages: –. If one only looks at the table of contents one might be mislead to think that the page numbers are: –

The table presented in the image:

Class Class Prefixes Object Pronouns Semantic tendencies of class pairings
1u/2 ū-/ø- wá/ɛ́ humans
1ø/2 ø-/ø-, wa-/a- wá/ɛ́ humans/ agentative
1ø/6 ø-/ɘ̄t- wá/tɔ́ humans
3u/2 ū-/ø- ɔ́/ɛ́ ‘giant’
7ø/2 ø-/ø- já/ɛ́ humans
5/2 ɘ̄r-/ø dɛ́/ɛ́ ‘puff adder’
5/6 ɘ̄r-/ɘ̄t- dɛ́/tɔ́ mostly inanimate / round
7u/2 ū-/ø- já/ɛ́ animates / fruits
3u/6 ū-/ɘ̄t- ɔ́/tɔ́ mostly inanimate objects
3ø/6 ø-/ɘ̄t- ɔ́/tɔ́ mostly inanimate objects
3u/4 ū-/ɘ̄s- ɔ́/sɛ́ only inanimate objects
3ø /4 ø-/ɘ̄s- ɔ́/sɛ́ only inanimate objects
5/4 ɘ̄r-/ɘ̄s- dɛ́/sɛ́ ‘thatch’/‘arrow’
7u/4 ū-/ɘ̄s- já/sɛ́ plants / long things / speech acts
7u/6 ū-/ɘ̄t- já/tɔ́ change over time/‘baby sling’
3u/aug ū-/ā- ɔ́/á augmentative
dim/4 ī-/ɘ̄s- ɛ́/sɛ́ ‘argument’
dim/6m ī-/ɘ̄m- ɛ́/mɔ́ diminutive
